CREATE.CREATE_A_NEW: Créer une nouvelle {{ ENTITY_TABLE }} en selectionant une {{ ENTITY_ID_FIELD }} libre:

NEW_VERSION: Psst... Il y a une nouvelle version de Keira!

SIDEBAR.UNSAVED_CHANGES: Vous avez des changements non enregistrés
SIDEBAR.MODAL_DISCONNECT: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir vous déconnecter?

DASHBOARD.WELCOME_1: You can always find the latest Keira3 version at the releases page. Join our #keira-editor channel on Discord to stay up to date with the latest news and releases!
DASHBOARD.WELCOME_2: Please report any bugs or suggestions using the official repository. If you like Keira3, don't forget to give us a ⭐ on GitHub!
DASHBOARD.WELCOME_3: Keira3 is free and open source software that we build during our own spare time, you can support us with a donation ❤
DASHBOARD.WELCOME_4: We hope that you enjoy using this software and don't forget to contribute with the community by sharing your code
DASHBOARD.SYSTEM_WARNING: WARNING: It looks like {{ DATABASE_NAME }} is not a valid AzerothCore world database.
DASHBOARD.SYSTEM_WARNING_1: If you selected the wrong database by mistake, you can logout and change it.
DASHBOARD.SYSTEM_WARNING_2: If you are using an old version of AzerothCore, we recommend to update it before using the editor.
DASHBOARD.SYSTEM_WARNING_3: If you are using a different emulator than AzerothCore, be aware that some features will be broken. More info are available here.
DASHBOARD.DEBUG_MODE: Enable Keira3 Debug mode (slower performance, to be used only for development)

SQL_EDITOR.TITLE: SQL Editor
SQL_EDITOR.TOOLTIP: A minimalistic SQL Editor to run custom queries

TEMPLATE.VEHICLE_ID_TOOLTIP: Entry of vehicle if creature is/has a vehicle entry. This field determines how the player appears on the vehicle, how the vehicle moves, and whether or not the vehicle action bar is shown. For example, a vehicleID of 292 will make the player invisible, prevent the vehicle from strafing left/right (but will allow forwards/backwards), and will show the vehicle action bar spells (which are defined in spell1-8). An npc_spellclick_spells entry must be made for this creature entry in order for this to work.
TEMPLATE.MODEL_ID_TOOLTIP: A random graphical model that the client applies on this creature. If you specify only one modelid and the rest will be equal to 0, model you have set won’t be chosen randomly. From creature_model_info.modelid
TEMPLATE.TRAINER_SPELL_TOOLTIP: If the NPC is a trainer that teaches professions (trainer_type = 2), then the player must already know the spell ID specified here to be able to talk to this NPC.
TEMPLATE.SPELLS_TOOLTIP: Spell ID that can be used for Mind Control of this creature. For vehicle creatures: the spell on action bar with position X.
TEMPLATE.SUBNAME: The subname of the creature that appears in <> below the creature name
TEMPLATE.MIN_MAX_LEVEL: The creature level will be in the range [minlevel, maxlevel]
TEMPLATE.RANK: If you want the creature to show a skull or “??” in the portrait (often with Bosses), you have to enable BOSS_MOB in type_flags
TEMPLATE.REGEN_HEALTH: Boolean (1 or 0) controlling whether the creature should regenerate its health or not.
TEMPLATE.RACIAL_LEADER: Boolean (1 or 0) indicating whether the creature is a racial leader or not.
TEMPLATE.PET_SPELL_DATA_ID: ID, found in CreatureSpellData.dbc, that displays what spells the pet has in the client. If the value here is 0 and it's a summoned pet, then it uses spells from creature_template_spell. If you have set values in both then a value above 0 here will override template_spell
TEMPLATE.KILL_CREDITS_DESC: Can be a link to the first entry of the creature that could be killed to give quest credit
TEMPLATE.MINGOLD: Minimum money that the creature drops when killed, in copper.
TEMPLATE.MAXGOLD: Maximum money that the creature drops when killed, in copper.
TEMPLATE.DIFFICULTY_ENTRY_1: Entry of the equivalent creature in Heroic Dungeon or 25man Normal Raid
TEMPLATE.DIFFICULTY_ENTRY_2: Entry of the equivalent creature in 10man Heroic Raid
TEMPLATE.difficulty_entry_3: Entry of the equivalent creature in 25man Heroic Raid
TEMPLATE.BASE_ATTACK_TIME: Base time (milliseconds) that determines how long a creature must wait between melee attacks.
TEMPLATE.RANGE_ATTACK_TIME: Base time (milliseconds) that determines how long a creature must wait between ranged attacks.
TEMPLATE.SCRIPT_NAME: Overrides AIName. The name of the C++ script that this creature uses, if any.
TEMPLATE.MOVEMENT_ID: It looks like this field is passed directly to the client and there is no info about it
TEMPLATE.HOVER_HEIGHT: Distance above the ground that the creature will hover if it has MOVEMENTFLAG_DISABLE_GRAVITY enabled
TEMPLATE.SCALE: Size multiplier (how big the creature model appears). If 0, it uses the DBC default model size.
TEMPLATE.DAMAGE_MODIFIER: Damage multiplier, affects mindmg and maxdmg. Increases auto attack damage and damage from spells or abilities that deals WEAPON based damage.
TEMPLATE.ARMOR_MODIFIER_TOOLTIP: Damage taken from physical attacks, a value of 1 is normal; Values under 1 mean it will take more damage; Values over 1 mean it will take less damage
TEMPLATE.SPEED_RUN: Controls how fast the creature can walk. For vehicles it increases the flying speed.
TEMPLATE.SPEED_WALK: Controls how fast the creature can run. For vehicles it increases ground movement speed.
TEMPLATE.SPEED_SWIM: Controls how fast the creature can swim.
TEMPLATE.SPEED_FLIGHT: Controls how fast the creature can fly.
TEMPLATE.DETECTION_RANGE: Controls the range at which creatures detect and see players.

TEMPLATE_ADDON.PATH_ID: If the creature has waypoint pathed movement, contains the waypoint_data.id for the path the creature is to follow.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.MOUNT: The model ID of the mount to be used to make the creature appear mounted. The value here overrides the value for the creature unit field UNIT_FIELD_MOUNTDISPLAYID.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.VISIBILITY_DISTANCE_TYPE: Normal = 0, 100.0f (default visible distance, 100 yards on continents); Tiny = 1, 25.0f; Small = 2, 50.0f; Large = 3, 200.0f; Gigantic = 4, 400.0f; Infinite = 5 (SIZE_OF_GRIDS max distance for visible objects)
TEMPLATE_ADDON.AURAS: A list of space separated auras to be applied on the creature. if the creature have data in spawn addon it will overide this

ONKILL_REPUTATION.IS_TEAM_AWARD1: Boolean (0 or 1) whether the player receives the reputation also the faction team or not.
ONKILL_REPUTATION.REW_ON_KILL_REP_VALUE1: The reputation value that the player gains (or loses if negative) by killing the creature.
ONKILL_REPUTATION.IS_TEAM_AWARD2: Boolean (0 or 1) whether the player receives the reputation also the faction team or not.
ONKILL_REPUTATION.REW_ON_KILL_REP_VALUE2: The reputation value that the player gains (or loses if negative) by killing the creature.
ONKILL_REPUTATION.TEAM_DEPENDENT_TOOLTIP: Boolean value. 0 - Will give reputation to the any player from both fields (RewOnKillRepFaction1 and RewOnKillRepFaction2); 1 - Will give reputation to alliance players from RewOnKillRepFaction1 and horde players from RewOnKillRepFaction2

SPAWN.ORIENTATION: The orientation of the creatures spawn point. (North = 0.0; South = pi (3.14159))
SPAWN.EQUIPMENT_ID_TOOLTIP: 1 = uses the info set in equipment template 0 = no weapons equipped
SPAWN.SPAWN_DIST_TOOLTIP: The maximum distance that the creature may spawn from its spawn point. Also controls how far away the creature can walk from its spawn point if its MovementType = 1.
SPAWN.SCRIPT_NAME: The name of the C++ script that this creature uses, if any.
SPAWN.PATH_ID: If the creature has waypoint pathed movement, contains the waypoint_data.id for the path the creature is to follow.
SPAWN.MOUNT: The model ID of the mount to be used to make the creature appear mounted. The value here overrides the value for the creature unit field UNIT_FIELD_MOUNTDISPLAYID.
SPAWN.VISIBILITY_DISTANCE_TYPE: Normal = 0, 100.0f (default visible distance, 100 yards on continents); Tiny = 1, 25.0f; Small = 2, 50.0f; Large = 3, 200.0f; Gigantic = 4, 400.0f; Infinite = 5 (SIZE_OF_GRIDS max distance for visible objects)
SPAWN.AURAS: A list of space separated auras to be applied on the creature.

TEMPLATE_MOVEMENT.INTERACTION_PAUSE_TIMER: Time (in milliseconds) during which creature will not move after interaction with player

NPC_TRAINER.MONEY_COST: The cost to pay to learn the spell represented in copper (1 gold = 100 silver = 10000 cooper)
NPC_TRAINER.REQ_SKILL_LINE: The required skill the player needs to have in order to be able to learn the spell
NPC_TRAINER.REQ_SKILL_RANK: The proficiency in the skill from reqskill that the player needs to meet to learn the spell
NPC_TRAINER.REQ_LEVEL: The minimum level the player needs to be in order to learn the spell.

NPC_VENDOR.SLOT: Position of the item in the vendor window
NPC_VENDOR.MAXCOUNT: The maximum number of items carried by the vendor at any time. 0 for infinite (if choosing a value of 1 or higher also requires incrtime value to work)
NPC_VENDOR.INCRTIME: Combined with maxcount, how often (in seconds) the vendor list is refreshed
NPC_VENDOR.EXTENDED_COST: Value comes from DBC and a selector for this will be implemented later in Keira3

TEMPLATE.QUEST_LEVEL: Level of the quest. Players receive full experience amount only if their level is <= Level+5. If -1, the player level will be used as Quest Level for experience calculation.
TEMPLATE.MIN_LEVEL: Minimum level at which a player can get the quest.
TEMPLATE.QUEST_SORT_ID: Defines under which category the quest falls in the quest log. Value taken from (if > 0) AreaTable.dbc or (if < 0) QuestSort.dbc
TEMPLATE.QUEST_INFO_ID: These values are ID taken from QuestInfo.dbc
TEMPLATE.SUGGESTED_GROUP_NUM: Recommended number of players to do the quest together.
TEMPLATE.START_ITEM: Items given by the quest giver at beginning of the quest. They will be deleted when quest is abandoned.
TEMPLATE.TIME_ALLOWED: Time (in seconds) that the player has to complete this quest
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_PLAYER_KILLS: How many players you need to kill in order to complete the quest.
TEMPLATE.POI_CONTINENT: MapId of the Point Of Interest that will be shown on the map when the quest is active
TEMPLATE.POI_X: X coordinate of the Point Of Interest that will be shown on the map when the quest is active
TEMPLATE.POI_Y: Y coordinate of the Point Of Interest that will be shown on the map when the quest is active
TEMPLATE.OBJECTIVE_TEXTS_TOOLTIP: Non-standard objective texts displayed in the quest log
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_ITEMS_TOOLTIP: Items required to complete the quest
TEMPLATE.REWARD_TALENTS: Amount of bonus talent points received when completing the quest
TEMPLATE.REWARD_ARENA_POINTS: Amount of arena points received when completing the quest
TEMPLATE.REWARD_NEXT_QUEST: The ID of the next quest that will be added automatically when completing the quest
TEMPLATE.REWARD_XP_DIFFICULTY: According to the Level, the basic experience with index RewardXPDifficulty is taken from QuestXP.dbc. Check the docs for more info.
TEMPLATE.REWARD_MONEY: If value > 0: money earned by completing the quest; if value < 0: money required to complete the quest
TEMPLATE.REWARD_BONUS_MONEY: The money a character at level 80 would get when they complete this quest.
TEMPLATE.REWARD_SPELL: Spell that is shown to be casted on quest completion in the quest log. Note that this spell will NOT be casted if RewardSpellCast is non-zero.
TEMPLATE.REWARD_HONOR: Number of honorable kill honor rewarded for completing this quest
TEMPLATE.REWARD_FACTIONS_TOOLTIP: Faction ID for which the quest adds (or subtracts) reputation points.

TEMPLATE_ADDON.PREV_QUEST_ID: if > 0: previous quest id; if < 0 parent quest id
TEMPLATE_ADDON.NEXT_QUEST_ID: Contains the next quest id, in case PrevQuestId of that other quest is not sufficient.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.MAX_LEVEL: Maximum player level at which a character can get the quest.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.SOURCE_SPELL_ID: The spell ID cast on player upon starting the quest.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.EXCLUSIVE_GROUP: If > 0: group of quests of which only one may be chosen and completed; if < 0  group of quests of which all must be completed and rewarded to start next quest
TEMPLATE_ADDON.PROVIDED_ITEM_COUNT: Number of items given to the player (inserted in the player’s bags) upon accepting the quest.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.REQ_SKILL_ID: Skill required to know to accept the quest. Use 0 for no skill required.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.REQ_SKILL_POINTS: Skill points required to have in order to accept the quest.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.REQ_MIN_REP_VALUE: Players must have this reputation or higher in order to receive the quest.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.REQ_MAX_REP_VALUE: The maximum reputation value that the player can have with a faction and still get the quest.
TEMPLATE_ADDON.REWARD_MAIL_TEMPLATE_ID: Corresponds to the loot template in quest_mail_loot_template; items will be sent by mail at quest completion
TEMPLATE_ADDON.REWARD_MAIL_DELAY: Delay (in seconds) after which the mail is sent to the character (defined in RewardMailTemplateId)

OFFER_REWARD.REWARD_TEXT: Quest gossip text shown when turning in a quest where no item delivery is involved.

REQUEST_ITEMS.COMPLETION_TEXT: Quest gossip text shown in the final gossip dialogue window when turning in an item delivery quest.
REQUEST_ITEMS.EMOTE_ON_COMPLETE: Played by the quest ender NPC when all quest objectives are completed.
REQUEST_ITEMS.EMOTE_ON_INCOMPLETE: Played by the quest ender NPC if any of the quest objectives are incomplete.

TEMPLATE.DISPLAY_ID: Graphic model id sent to the client from GameObjectDisplayInfo.dbc
TEMPLATE.DATA_TOOLTIP: Data0-Data23 fields change their meanings according to the selected TYPE. Keira3 will try to reflect their names and show tooltips accordingly whenever the gameobject TYPE is changed
TEMPLATE.DIFFICULTY: 0=(5 and 10 man normal); 1=(5 man heroic, 25 normal); 2=(10 man heroic); 3=(25 man heroic)
TEMPLATE.SPELL_FOCUS_TYPE: From SpellFocusObject.dbc; value also appears as RequiresSpellFocus in Spell.dbc
TEMPLATE.SPELL_UNKNOWN_ID: Unknown ID, not a spell id in dbc file, maybe server only side spell
TEMPLATE.PARTY_ONLY: Boolean flag, need to be in group to use it
TEMPLATE.BOOLEAN_FLAG_SPAWN: Boolean flag controling if gameobject will despawn or not
TEMPLATE.SPAWN_TYPE: 0 trap with no despawn after cast. 1 trap despawns after cast. 2 bomb casts on spawn
TEMPLATE.MIN_RESTOCK: Min successful loot attempts for Mining, Herbalism etc
TEMPLATE.MAX_RESTOCK: Max successful loot attempts for Mining, Herbalism etc
TEMPLATE.MINIMAL_LEVEL: minimal level required to open this gameobject
TEMPLATE.LEVEL_CASTED_SPELL: npc equivalent level for casted spell
TEMPLATE.CHAIR_SLOTS: number of players that can sit down on it
TEMPLATE.TIME_MS_BEFORE_STATE: in ms before the initial state is restored
TEMPLATE.SPELL_ID_FROM_DBC: Spell Id from Spell.dbc. If the spell is a teleport spell, also needs info set in spell_target_position table in world DB

SPAWN.ORIENTATION: The orientation of the creatures spawn point. (North = 0.0; South = pi (3.14159))
SPAWN.STATE: For chests or doors. 1 = closed  0 = open
SPAWN.SCRIPT_NAME: The name of the C++ script that this creature uses, if any.

TEMPLATE.ENTRY: The unique entry of the item
TEMPLATE.NAME: The name of the item
TEMPLATE.DESCRIPTION: The description that appears in orange letters at the bottom of the item tooltip.
TEMPLATE.SCRIPT_NAME: The name of the script that the item should use
TEMPLATE.SUBCLASS: The subclass meaning varies according to the item class (so the class must be set BEFORE the subclass)
TEMPLATE.SOUND_OVERRIDE_SUBCLASS: Weapons have special sounds on impact, this field is used to override them sounds by specifying another subclass
TEMPLATE.DISPLAYID: The model ID of the item. Controls both the model appearance and the icon.
TEMPLATE.BUY_COUNT: The size of the item stack when sold by vendors. If a vendor has limited copies of this item available, every time the vendor list is refreshed (See npc_vendor.incrtime), the number of copies increases by this number.
TEMPLATE.BUY_PRICE: The price required to pay to buy this item from a vendor, in copper.
TEMPLATE.SELL_PRICE: The price that the vendor will pay you for the item when you sell it, in copper. 0 if the item cannot be sold to a vendor.
TEMPLATE.MAXCOUNT: Maximum number of copies of this item which a player can have. Use 0 for infinite.
TEMPLATE.STACKABLE: The number of copies of this item that can be stacked in the same slot.
TEMPLATE.STARTQUEST: The ID of the quest that this item will start if right-clicked. See quest_template.id
TEMPLATE.RANDOM_PROPERTY: Points to item_enchantment_template.entry and ties in an item’s chance at having a random property attached to it when it shows up for the first time. Cannot be non-zero if also RandomSuffix is non-zero.
TEMPLATE.RANDOM_SUFFIX: Points to item_enchantment_template.entry and ties in an item’s chance at having a random suffix attached to it when it shows up for the first time. Cannot be non-zero if also RandomProperty is non-zero.
TEMPLATE.CONTAINER_SLOTS: If the item is a bag, this field controls the number of slots the bag has.
TEMPLATE.DURATION: The duration of the item in seconds ingame time. Set ITEM_FLAGS_CU_DURATION_REAL_TIME in flagsCustom for real time. In that case the item duration will tick even if player is offline.
TEMPLATE.DISENCHANT_ID: The disenchant loot template ID. Corresponds to disenchant_loot_template.entry
TEMPLATE.MIN_MONEY_LOOT: Minimum amount of money contained in the item, in copper
TEMPLATE.MAX_MONEY_LOOT: Maximum amount of money contained in the item, in copper
TEMPLATE.ITEMSET: The ID of the item set that this item belongs to. Item sets are defined in the ItemSet DBC file.
TEMPLATE.PAGE_TEXT: The ID referring to the text that the item will show (if it is a book or a letter, etc). The item will have a magnifying glass cursor in the game and will show the text when right-clicked. See page_text.entry
TEMPLATE.PAGE_MATERIAL: The background texture that appears in the page text window. See the PageTextMaterial DBC file for the IDs of all of the material types.
TEMPLATE.LANG_ID: The language that the item text is written in. See the Languages DBC file for the IDs of all of the languages.
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_LEVEL: The level required to equip the item
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_SKILL: The skill required to use this item. See the SkillLine DBC file for IDs which can be used here.
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_SKILL_RANK: The skill rank required to use this item
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_SPELL: The required spell that the player needs to have to use this item.
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_HONORRANK: The honor rank required to use this item
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_CITY_RANK: Its use is unknown. All items have 0
TEMPLATE.REQUIRED_DISENCHANT_SKILL: The required skill proficiency in disenchanting that the player needs to have to be able to disenchant this item.
TEMPLATE.MAP: The ID of the map in which this item can be used
TEMPLATE.AREA: The ID of the zone in which this item can be used
TEMPLATE.HOLIDAY_ID: See the Holidays DBC file for the IDs of all of the holidays.
TEMPLATE.LOCKID: The lock entry ID that this item (which serves as a key) is tied to. This field is used in key-door mechanics. See the Lock DBC file.
TEMPLATE.SCALING_STAT_DISTRIBUTION: Similar to Static Stats these are the Stats that grow along with the users level (mainly heirloom leveling gear) use like static stats.
TEMPLATE.STATS_COUNT: When an item has entries in stat_type, this must be updated to display those entries (Unknown how this works).
TEMPLATE.STAT_VALUE: The value to change the stat type to
TEMPLATE.GEM_PROPERTIES: Corresponds to the ID in GemProperties.dbc
TEMPLATE.SOCKET_CONTENTS: The amount of Gems of SocketColor_{{idx}}
TEMPLATE.ARMOR: The armor value of the item
TEMPLATE.ARMOR_DAMAGE_MODIFIER: The time in milliseconds between successive hits
TEMPLATE.DELAY: The type of ammunition the item uses. Arrows = 2; Bullets = 3
TEMPLATE.AMMO_TYPE: Range Modifier for bows/guns/crossbows: Default range is somewhere between 0.3 and 0.4 yards, all blizzard ranged weapons have RangedModRange100
TEMPLATE.RANGED_MOD_RANGE: If the item is a shield, the block chance of the shield
TEMPLATE.BLOCK: The maximum durability of this item
TEMPLATE.MAX_DURABILITY: The minimum damage of the item
TEMPLATE.DMG_MIN: The maximum damage of the item
TEMPLATE.DMG_MAX: The spells that the item can cast or trigger
TEMPLATE.SPELL_CHARGES: The number of times that the item can cast the spell. If 0, then infinite charges are possible. If negative, then after the number of charges is depleted, the item is deleted as well. If positive, then the item is not deleted after all the charges are spent.
TEMPLATE.SPELL_PPM_RATES: The proc per minute rate controlling how often the spell is triggered (if #spelltrigger == 2).
TEMPLATE.SPELL_COOLDOWNS: The cooldown in milliseconds for the specific spell controlling how often the spell can be used. Use -1 to use the default spell cooldown. Note: this is not the “internal cooldown” of procs commonly found on items such as trinkets with “Chance on hit” effects.
TEMPLATE.SPELL_CATEGORIES: The category that the spell is in
TEMPLATE.SPELL_CATEGORY_COOLDOWNS: The cooldown time in milliseconds that is applied to all other spells in the category that the triggered spell is also in. Use -1 to use the default spell cooldown.

LOOT_EDITOR.REFERENCE: Include a group of loots. Linked to referenced_loot_template.entry
LOOT_EDITOR.QUEST_REQUIRED: The item should be shown only to characters having the appropriate quest.
LOOT_EDITOR.GROUP_ID: Set of loot definitions, check the wiki for more details
LOOT_EDITOR.MIN_COUNT: The minimum number of copies of the item that can drop in a single loot. For references, this is ignored.
LOOT_EDITOR.MAX_COUNT: The maximum number of copies of the item that can drop in a single loot. For references, this is the EXACT count value.
LOOT_EDITOR.COMMENT: A comment that is ignored by the core

GOSSIP_MENU.TEXT_ID_TOOLTIP: The npc_text.ID for the gossip you want to be initially displayed. Also this tells the NPC what to say at the top of the options menu when it is displayed.

GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.OPTION_ID: Must be unique for a given menu_id starting from 0 (zero).
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.OPTION_TEXT: Text displayed in the player selectable option. Examples would be: “Learn Dual Spec“. Only if OptionBroadcastTextID contains a valid broadcast_text.ID
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.OPTION_BROADCAST_TEXT_ID: The ID of the same text in broadcast_text.ID.
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.OPTION_NPC_FLAG: Reference to creature_template.npcflag, this is the npcflag that the NPC must have
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.ACTION_MENU_ID: If you want to create a sub-menu, this is the ID (gossip_menu.entry / gossip_menu_option.menu_id) to link to to create that sub-menu.
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.ACTION_POI_ID: If you want a POI (point of interest) to display on the minimap (like how a city guard places a marker when you ask directions), this is the `entry` from Points_of_interest.entry
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.BOX_CODED: If you want a box to display where you have to enter a code, this is the field you use.
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.BOX_MONEY: The amount of money the player has to pay for the selected option, the value must be in copper. 10g = 100000 (10g 00s 00c)
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.BOX_TEXT: This is the text of the window that appears that has “Yes” or “No” as clickable buttons. This is useful if you want a Yes/No confirmation window before the script executes
GOSSIP_MENU_OPTION.BOX_BROADCAST_TEXT_ID: The ID of the same text in broadcast_text.ID.

EDITOR.ELSE_GROUP: Allows building grouped conditions - all entries belonging to the same condition (same SourceType, SourceGroup and SourceEntry) that share the same number in ElseGroup, define one group. The entire condition is met when any of its groups is met (logical OR). The group is met when all of its entries are met (logical AND).
EDITOR.NEGATIVE_CONDITION: If set to 1, the condition will be inverted
EDITOR.ERROR_TYPE: Id from SharedDefines.h, will be displayed for CONDITION_SOURCE_TYPE_SPELL
EDITOR.ERROR_TEXT_ID: Id from SharedDefines.h, will be displayed for CONDITION_SOURCE_TYPE_SPELL
EDITOR.SCRIPT_NAME: The ScriptName this condition uses, if any.
EDITOR.COMMENT: Explanation of this condition or reference

GROUP.SOURCE_TYPE_SPELL_IMPLICIT_TARGET: 'Mask of effects to be affected by condition: 1 = EFFECT_0, 2 = EFFECT_1, 4 = EFFECT_2

ENTRY.SOURCE_TYPE_SPELL_PROC: Spell ID of aura which triggers the proc

TARGET.SOURCE_TYPE_SPELL: 0 = spell Caster;  1 =  Explicit Target of the spell (only for spells which take the object selected by caster into account)
TARGET.SOURCE_TYPE_VEHICLE_SPELL: 0 = Player for whom spell bar is shown;  1 =  Vehicle creature

VALUE1.CONDITION_ZONEID: Zone ID where this condition will be true.
VALUE1.CONDITION_INSTANCE_INFO: entry (see corresponding source script files for info)
VALUE1.CONDITION_CLASS: Class mask from ChrClasses.dbc. Add flags together for all classes where condition is true
VALUE1.CONDITION_RACE: Player must be this race. See ChrRaces.dbc. Add flags together for all races where condition is true.
VALUE1.CONDITION_MAPID: Map entry from Map.dbc (0=Eastern Kingdoms, 1=Kalimdor, etc..)
VALUE1.CONDITION_CREATURE_TYPE: Creature type from creature_template.type (True if creature_template.type == ConditionValue1)
VALUE1.CONDITION_TYPE_MASK: TypeMask - a bitmask of following object types: 0x0008 - TYPEMASK_UNIT (8) 0x0010 - TYPEMASK_PLAYER (16) 0x0020 - TYPEMASK_GAMEOBJECT (32) 0x0080 - TYPEMASK_CORPSE (player corpse after spirit release) (128)
VALUE1.CONDITION_TO: Target to which relation is checked. One of the ConditionTargets available in current SourceType
VALUE1.CONDITION_STAND_STATE: stateType ("exact" or "any"): 0 = Exact state used in ConditionValue2;   1 = Any type of state in ConditionValue2

VALUE2.CONDITION_INSTANCE_INFO: data (see corresponding script source files for more info)
VALUE2.CONDITION_LEVEL: Optional: 0 = Level must be equal, 1 = Level must be higher, 2 = Level must be lower, 3 = Level must be higher or equal, 4 = Level must be lower or equal.
VALUE2.CONDITION_OBJECT_ENTRY_GUID: 0 = Any object of given TypeID; if TypeID = TYPEID_UNIT => Creature entry from creature_template.entry; if TypeID = TYPEID_GAMEOBJECT => Gameobject entry from gameobject_template.entry
VALUE2.CONDITION_RELATION_TO: RelationType - defines relation of current ConditionTarget to target specified in ConditionValue1. 0 - RELATION_SELF; 1 - RELATION_IN_PARTY; 2 - RELATION_IN_RAID_OR_PARTY; 3 - RELATION_OWNED_BY (ConditionTarget is owned by ConditionValue1); 4 - RELATION_PASSENGER_OF (ConditionTarget is passenger of ConditionValue1); 5 - RELATION_CREATED_BY (ConditionTarget is summoned by ConditionValue1)
VALUE2.CONDITION_DISTANCE_TO: Defines distance between current ConditionTarget and target specified in ConditionValue1
VALUE2.CONDITION_HP_VAL: ComparisionType:; 0 = HP must be equal; 1 = HP must be higher; 2 = HP must be lesser; 3 = HP must be equal or higher; 4 = HP must be equal or lower
VALUE2.CONDITION_HP_PCT: ComparisionType: 0 = Percentage of max HP must be equal; 1 = Percentage of max HP must be higher; 2 = Percentage of max HP must be lower; 3 = Percentage of max HP must be equal or higher; 4 = Percentage of max HP must be equal or lower
VALUE2.CONDITION_STAND_STATE: Exact stand state, or generic state (stand/sit), depending on value 10 = Standing; 1 = Sitting

VALUE3.CONDITION_OBJECT_ENTRY_GUID: 0 = Any object of given type;  1 - 500k = creature/gameobject GUID
VALUE3.CONDITION_DISTANCE_TO: ComparisionType: 0 = distance must be equal to ConditionValue2; 1 = distance must be higher than ConditionValue2; 2 = distance must be lower than ConditionValue2; 3 = distance must be equal to or higher than ConditionValue2; 4 = distance must be equal to or lower than ConditionValue2

EDITOR.UNIQUE_ID: A unique identifier for each row
EDITOR.CHANCE: This is the probability of the event to occur as a percentage from 0-100. Example: if you want the event to occur roughly half of the time, then set this to 50.
EDITOR.TIMED_ACTIONLISTS: All smart_scripts having source_type = 9 and entryorguid between CreatureID * 100 and CreatureID * 100 + 100

BASE.CATEGORY: Category of a spell. Used for category cooldowns. Link to entry in SpellCategory.dbc
BASE.SPELL_LEVEL: Tends to be exactly same as base level.
BASE.MAX_LEVEL: Probably maximal level from which spell can gain bonuses (or minuses) which are based on formula caster level - spell level.
BASE.MIN_FACTION_ID: ID of required reputation with a faction that is needed to cast the spell.
BASE.MIN_REPUTATION: Probably either value or level of required reputation with a faction that is needed to cast the spell.
BASE.SPELL_DIFFICULTY_ID: Alternative spells which get used in different Raid difficulties instead. Link to entry in SpellDifficulty.dbc
BASE.REQUIRED_AREAS_ID: Areas in which a spell can be cast. Link to entry in AreaGroup.dbc
BASE.SPELL_CLASS_SET: For which class the spell is intended.
BASE.MANA_COST: Base power cost of a spell. It is being summed with ManaCostPercentage. Seems to be used for other power types as well
BASE.MANA_COST_PER_LEVEL: Likely is mana cost increased by ((caster level) - (spell level))*(this field).
BASE.MANA_PER_SECOND: Mana cost per second for channeling spells.
BASE.MANA_PER_SECOND_PER_LEVEL: For channels. Likely is mana cost per second increased by ((caster level) - (spell level))*(this field).
BASE.MANA_COST_PCT: % of base mana cost, added to flat value in manaCost field. For NPCs is base mana = their max mana.
BASE.RUNE_COST_ID: Rune costs for death knights. Link to entry in SpellRuneCost.dbc
BASE.MECHANIC: Used by spells granting bonuses/immunities against certain effect types (stun, charm...).
BASE.DEFENSE_TYPE: Seems to be used to define what type of ?damage? the spell is doing
BASE.PREVENTION_TYPE: Under which conditions the spell is prevented to be cast.
BASE.DISPEL_TYPE: For determining which spells are capable of dispelling this.
BASE.SCHOOL_MASK: School of a spell. Used for specific the Spell's element kind.
BASE.RANGE_INDEX: Range of a spell. May differ for friendly and enemy targets. Link to entry in SpellRange.dbc
BASE.MAX_TARGETS: Maximum number of targets the spell can affect.
BASE.MAX_TARGET_LEVEL: The maximum level of target which can be affected by spell.
BASE.CASTER_AURA_STATE: Which condition has to be fulfilled to cast the spell
BASE.CASTER_AURA_SPELL: Which Aura has to be active to be able to cast the spell
BASE.TARGET_AURA_STATE: Which condition has to be fulfilled to cast the spell on a target.
BASE.TARGET_AURA_SPELL: Which Aura has to be active on the target to be able to cast the spell
BASE.REQUIRES_SPELL_FOCUS: Whether spell focus is needed by spell to be cast. Player needs to be within range of appropriate gameobject with type=8.
BASE.CUMULATIVE_AURA: For stackable spells, maximal amount of stacks on target. For non-stackable spells leave 0.
BASE.RECOVERY_TIME: Cooldown of a spell. May differ with caster level.
BASE.CATEGORY_RECOVERY_TIME: Cooldown applied by spell on all spells with the same Category. Link to entry in SpellCategory.dbc
BASE.CASTING_TIME_INDEX: Casting time of a spell. May differ with caster level. Links to SpellCastTimes.dbc
BASE.DURATION_INDEX: Duration of spell effects. Link to entry in SpellDuration.dbc
BASE.SPEED: ?Casting speed modifier? If <= 0.0 client skips HandleMissileEffects.
BASE.SPELL_ICON_ID: ID of icon used while spell is not active. Link to entry in SpellIcon.dbc
BASE.ACTIVE_ICON_ID: ID of icon used while spell is active. Used e.g. Stealth. Link to entry in SpellIcon.dbc
BASE.STANCE_BAR_ORDER: On which slot of the stance bar (e.g. Paladin Auras) the spell is displayed.
BASE.SPELL_VISUAL_ID_1: Visual effects of a spell. Link to entry in SpellVisual.dbc
BASE.SPELL_VISUAL_ID_2: Visual effects of a spell. Link to entry in SpellVisual.dbc
BASE.SPELL_MISSILE_ID: Used for creating Visual Spell effects. Link to SpellMissile.dbc

FLAGS.TARGET_CREATURE_TYPE: Mask of creature types on which is spell usable. 0 = None
FLAGS.SHAPESHIFT_MASK: Shapeshifts/Stances in which the spell is castable. 0 = No shape/stance required
FLAGS.SHAPESHIFT_EXCLUDE: Shapeshifts/Stances in which the spell is not castable. 0 = No restriction
FLAGS.FACING_CASTER_FLAGS: If marked, forces the Caster to use the ability in front of the enemy.
FLAGS.INTERRUPT_FLAGS_TOOLTIP: Mask of cases which interrupt casting of a spell. 0 = None
FLAGS.AURA_INTERRUPT_FLAGS: Mask of cases which interrupt casting of a spell. 0 = None
FLAGS.CHANNEL_INTERRUPT_FLAGS: Mask of cases which interrupt casting of a spell. 0 = None

ITEMS.EQUIPPED_ITEM_CLASS: item_template.class value which casters item held in hand must have
ITEMS.EQUIPPED_ITEM_SUBCLASS: Mask of item_template.subclass values which caster's item held in hand must have
ITEMS.EQUIPPED_ITEM_INV_TYPES: Mask of item_template.InventoryType values which targeted item must have
ITEMS.TOTEM_1: Non consumable item required to cast the spell.
ITEMS.TOTEM_2: Non consumable item required to cast the spell.
ITEMS.REQUIRED_TOTEM_CATEGORY_ID_1: Non consumable items (e.g. enchanter rods) required to cast the spell.
ITEMS.REQUIRED_TOTEM_CATEGORY_ID_2: Non consumable items (e.g. enchanter rods) required to cast the spell.
ITEMS.REAGENT: Entry of item used by this spell as resources. Gets consumed. Materials for professions.
ITEMS.REAGENT_COUNT: Number of reagent items needed by spell

EFFECTS.TARGETS: Which type of targets can be targeted by the Spell. 0 = TARGET_FLAG_NONE
EFFECTS.PROC_TYPE_MASK: Under which conditions a spell can proc. 0 = PROC_FLAG_NONE
EFFECTS.PROC_CHANCE: Most spells with 100% chance tend to have value 101.
EFFECTS.PROC_CHARGES: How many times a spell can proc. 0 = infinite

FIELD.EFFECT: Type of effect which spell has. All following effect fields refer to these.
FIELD.EFFECT_BASE_POINTS: Base points added to result of according effects rolled dice. e.g. EffectDieSides=26 and EffectBasePoints=49 will make 50-75.
FIELD.EFFECT_REAL_POINTS_PER_LEVEL: Base points added to according EffectBasePoints based on caster level.
FIELD.EFFECT_RADIUS_INDEX: According spell effect radius. May differ with caster level. Link to entry in SpellRadius.dbc
FIELD.EFFECT_MISC_VALUE: Used for according effects special misc values, commonly entries of called or used creature/item/gameobject.
FIELD.EFFECT_MISC_VALUE_B: Used for according effects special misc values, commonly entries of called or used creature/item/gameobject.
FIELD.EFFECT_TRIGGER_SPELL: Entry of spell triggered on affected target by this according effect.
FIELD.EFFECT_POINTS_PER_COMBO: Bonus to effect base value based on amount of combo points on target.
FIELD.EFFECT_DIE_SIDES: Number of sides of dice which is being rolled for random value of according effect.
FIELD.EFFECT_CHAIN_AMPLITUDE: Used for decreasing (or increasing) according effect value on next chained targets.
FIELD.EFFECT_BONUS_MULTIPLIER: Seems to be used for calculation of the according effect value of ticks for DoTs and HoTs.
FIELD.EFFECT_MECHANIC: Mechanic of according spell effect. Used by spells granting bonuses/immunities against certain effect types (stun, charm...).
FIELD.EFFECT_AURA: Type of aura (effect of effect) which according effect applies.
FIELD.EFFECT_AURA_PERIOD: How often the effect ticks in ms.
FIELD.SPELL_CLASS_MASK: ?Mask for spells which are affected (buffed, ...) by this spell?
FIELD.IMPLICIT_TARGET_A: Type of implicit target(s) of according effect.
FIELD.IMPLICIT_TARGET_B: Type of implicit target(s) of according effect.
FIELD.EFFECT_CHAIN_TARGETS: ?Used to create chaining visual effects (e.g. chain lightning)?
FIELD.EFFECT_SPELL_CLASS_MASK_A: Entry of fields 210-212 as hex value of the spell this spell is affecting. Used for effect #1
FIELD.EFFECT_SPELL_CLASS_MASK_B: Entry of fields 210-212 as hex value of the spell this spell is affecting. Used for effect #2
FIELD.EFFECT_SPELL_CLASS_MASK_C: Entry of fields 210-212 as hex value of the spell this spell is affecting. Used for effect #3

MISC.START_RECOVERY_CATEGORY: The only value which seems to be used here apart of 0 is 133 (spells affected by global CD).
MISC.START_RECOVERY_TIME: The only value (in ms) which seems to be used here apart of 0 is 1500 (global CD value).
MISC.MODAL_NEXT_SPELL: Seems to be only used for Hunter spells with the values 59 and 75.
MISC.SPELL_PRIORITY: Unknown. Only used value is 50 for some spells.
MISC.REQUIRED_AURA_VISION: Unknown. Only 16 Spells use another value as 0. Could be used for visual effects.
